ygData.subject: Re: 1 step mechanisme
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi!! I have already solved this problem. For 1step-reaction CH4 + 2 O2 = CO2 + 2 H2O is sufficient to modifie the orders of the reaction in the .cti file.

Hi!!
I have already solved this problem. For 1step-reaction CH4 + 2 O2 =3D=
>
CO2 + 2 H2O is sufficient to modifie the orders of the reaction in the
.c=
ti file. Now, i'm trying to perform a 1D premixed flame with a 2step
reacti=
on:
1) CH4 +1.5 02 =3D> CO +2 H2O, Arrhenius parameters=3D[0.6000E+16, 0.0,=

35000], order=3D"CH4:0.9 O2:1.10 "
2) CO + 0.5 O2 <=3D> CO2, Arrhenius par=
ametr=3D[0.2E+10, 0.0, 12000].
In this case it is not sufficent to change t=
he order of the reaction
to achieve some good results. Actually, the method=
 is convergent but,
even if the adiabatic temperature and the mole fraction=
s of the
species are correct, the speed flame is completly wrong. I can't f=
ind
where is the problem. I hope to have benn sufficiently clear. 
Thanks f=
or any helps
Benedetta

anzelli"
<benedetta.franzelli@...> wrote:

> Hi..I would like to use Cante=
ra to study air_Methane combustion with 1

2 O2 =3D> CO2 + 2 H2O .

} | X k | ^nk'
> - Kr  Prod_{k=3D1}^{N} | X k | ^nk''
> where Kf e Kr are t=
he forward and reverse rates of reaction, n is the
> number of species, | X=
 k | are the molar concentrations. The forward
> rate of reaction is modele=
d using the Arrhenius law and modifing the
> .cti file. But I can't find ho=
w to set with Cantera the values of nk'

t for each species. Is it possible  to
